abstract: Adaptive reuse has become increasingly common way to provide housing for older residents in New Jersey; nonprofit organizations like Build With Purpose are transforming shuttered buildings into boarding-home-style residences; affordable housing experts say strategy can sometimes run up against same financing and bureaucratic challenges face by developers building housing from scratch.

headline.print_headline: Seniors Find Homes in Converted Spaces
headline.main: New Jersey Groups Convert Empty Buildings Into Homes for Seniors

snippet: Buildings that once served as convents and schools are being transformed into living spaces for older adults.
lead_paragraph: Buildings that once served as convents and schools are being transformed into living spaces for older adults.
